# PhysicsSimulationComponent

**Structure**

A component that controls localized physics simulations.

## Declaration

```swift
struct PhysicsSimulationComponent
```

## Overview

Simulate local physics by adding a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsSimulationComponent] to an entity. The component gives your app the ability to customize the physics simulation by configuring its properties, such as [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsSimulationComponent/gravity] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsSimulationComponent/collisionOptions-swift.property].



## Structures

- **PhysicsSimulationComponent.CollisionOptions**: The options set that defines how a physics simulation reports collisions.
- **PhysicsSimulationComponent.SolverIterations**: The parameters that control the accuracy of solving physics simulations.

## Initializers

- **init()**

## Instance Properties

- **clock**: A custom clock which drives the physics simulation, defaults to the engine clock.
- **collisionOptions**: Options for kinematic collision reporting.
- **gravity**: The gravity for the simulation relative to the simulation entity.
- **solverIterations**: The parameters that control the accuracy of solving physics simulations.

## Type Methods

- **nearestSimulationEntity(for:)**: Obtains the entity containing the physics simulation origin.

## Simulation setup

- **Designing scene hierarchies for efficient physics simulation**: Configure your RealityKit scenes to avoid performance bottlenecks.
- **Handling different-sized objects in physics simulations**: Set up a scene hierarchy for accurate physics simulations.

## Conforms To

- Component
- Equatable
